hero.title: Comprehensive Guide to Work Permits in Sweden
hero.subtitle: Explore the variety of work permits available for different types of employment in Sweden, with unique requirements for each option.

intro.heading: Understanding Work Permits in Sweden
intro.description: Sweden offers a variety of work permits for different types of employment, each with unique requirements. If you're planning to work in Sweden, it's essential to understand the options available and ensure you meet the updated criteria.
intro.toolLink: Sweden Relocators offers a Work Permit Assessment Tool on our website, allowing you to quickly determine your eligibility and the best permit for your circumstances.

permitTypes.heading: Types of Work Permits in Sweden

permits.title: Standard Work Permit for Employment
permits.description: For individuals who have secured employment in Sweden

requirements.label: Job Offer
requirements.description: You must have a confirmed job offer with a Swedish employer.

requirements.label: Minimum Salary
requirements.description: Around SEK 30,000 before taxes. Must meet Swedish collective agreements or industry standards.

requirements.label: Employment Conditions
requirements.description: Must adhere to Swedish standards for health, insurance, and pension contributions.

requirements.label: Advertisement Requirement
requirements.description: Job must be advertised within EU/EEA for at least 10 days before hiring a non-EU citizen.

permits.duration: Up to 2 years, with possibility of extension

permits.title: EU Blue Card
permits.description: For highly qualified professionals with skills in demand across the EU

requirements.label: Higher Education
requirements.description: University degree or at least 5 years of relevant professional experience required.

requirements.label: Salary Threshold
requirements.description: Job offer with salary exceeding the EU Blue Card minimum threshold for Sweden.

permits.duration: Up to 4 years based on employment contract

permits.title: Seasonal Worker Permit
permits.description: For short-term seasonal work in agriculture (berry pickers and plant workers)

requirements.label: Employment Contract
requirements.description: Contract from Swedish employer for seasonal work up to 6 months.

requirements.label: Wages and Benefits
requirements.description: Must be in line with Swedish collective agreements.

requirements.label: Health Insurance
requirements.description: Must have health insurance covering the stay.

permits.duration: Duration of employment contract, typically up to 6 months

permits.title: Au Pair Permit
permits.description: For young individuals (18â€“30 years) living with a host family

requirements.label: Age Requirement
requirements.description: Must be between 18 and 30 years old.

requirements.label: Host Family Contract
requirements.description: Formal agreement specifying duties, working hours, and pay.

requirements.label: Language Study
requirements.description: Required to take Swedish language courses during stay.

requirements.label: Minimum Allowance
requirements.description: Host family must provide allowance meeting Sweden's au pair wage standard.

permits.title: Working Holiday Visa
permits.description: For young people from specific countries to work and travel

requirements.label: Eligible Countries
requirements.description: Australia, New Zealand, South Korea, Canada, Japan, Argentina, and others.

requirements.label: Age Requirement
requirements.description: Typically for individuals between 18 and 30 years.

requirements.label: Sufficient Funds
requirements.description: Proof of funds to support oneself initially.

permits.duration: Valid for one year with certain employment restrictions

permits.title: Self-Employment Permit
permits.description: For entrepreneurs and self-employed individuals establishing a business

requirements.label: Business Plan
requirements.description: Viable business plan demonstrating profitability within two years.

requirements.label: Sufficient Funds
requirements.description: Proof of funds to support business and personal expenses during initial phase.

requirements.label: Business Experience
requirements.description: Documented experience in running a business or industry-specific expertise.

permits.title: Sports and Cultural Worker Permit
permits.description: For individuals working in sports, arts, or cultural fields

requirements.label: Employment or Sponsorship
requirements.description: Job offer from Swedish organization within sports or culture.

requirements.label: Salary Standards
requirements.description: Wages consistent with collective agreements and Swedish standards.

permits.duration: Duration of contract with extension options

permits.title: Researcher Permit
permits.description: For researchers offered positions with accredited Swedish institutions

requirements.label: Host Agreement
requirements.description: Agreement with research institution detailing activity, funding, and conditions.

requirements.label: Project Funding
requirements.description: Financial support for the research project duration.

permits.duration: Length of research project with extension options

process.heading: Application Process and Waiting Times
process.intro: The application process and waiting times vary based on permit type, circumstances, and current Migration Agency workload.
process.tool: Using our Work Permit Assessment Tool can help you identify the right permit and provide estimated processing times based on your case.

generalRequirements.heading: General Requirements for All Work Permits
generalRequirements.description: Regardless of permit type, all applicants must meet these core requirements:

requirements.title: Valid Passport
requirements.description: Must be valid for the entire period of your intended stay.

requirements.title: Health Insurance
requirements.description: Some permits (Working Holiday, Au Pair) require health insurance coverage.

requirements.title: Clean Criminal Record
requirements.description: Serious criminal records may result in permit denial.

support.heading: How Sweden Relocators Can Assist You
support.description: Sweden Relocators provides full support for all types of work permits, ensuring a smooth and efficient process:

services.title: Eligibility Assessment
services.description: Use our Work Permit Assessment Tool to find the best permit for your circumstances.

services.title: Document Preparation
services.description: We assist in compiling employment contracts, financial statements, and health insurance proof.

services.title: Application & Tracking
services.description: We handle submission and keep you updated through each application stage.

services.title: Post-Permit Support
services.description: Housing assistance, bank account setup, and registration with Swedish authorities.

cta.heading: Start Your Work Permit Journey Today
cta.description: Contact Sweden Relocators to begin your work permit application and start your career journey in Sweden.
cta.subtext: Visit our Work Permit Section or contact us for more information.
